title: Stop, Check, Protect (your default anti-scam routine)
summary: A simple routine to avoid most scams: stop before you act, check independently, and protect yourself by reporting and securing accounts.
how_it_works: STOP: Don’t send money or personal info and don’t click links when unsure.
CHECK: Verify messages by contacting the organisation using details you find yourself.
PROTECT: Report scams and secure accounts (passwords, bank/card alerts, etc.).
warning_signs: Requests for money, personal info, or secrecy.
what_to_do: If you think it’s a scam: stop sending money, contact your bank, change passwords, and report.
Teach family members the same routine to reduce risk.
Use official apps/websites instead of message links.

quick_quiz.q: What’s the safest way to get to the real website?
choices: Click the link in the message
Type the website address yourself or use the official app
Reply and ask them for another link
quick_quiz.explain: Scam messages often include links to fake sites. Typing the address yourself (or using the official app) reduces that risk.

quick_quiz.q: A message says you must act 'within 24 hours' or you'll lose access. What should you do first?
choices: Stop and verify using official contact details you find yourself
Forward it to friends to ask
quick_quiz.explain: Urgency is a classic pressure tactic. Verify using trusted contact details.
